snippet: It was the judiciary’s first riposte after a property baron, testifying in a corruption case, accused the chief justice of accepting $3.7 million in kickbacks and cash.
abstract: Pakistan’s Supreme Court initiates contempt-of-court proceedings against a property baron who a day earlier accused the chief justice’s family of accepting $3.7 million in kickbacks and cash payments; contempt proceedings mark the judiciary’s first riposte in an extraordinary scandal that threatens Chief Justice Iftikhar Muhammad Chaudhry, who in some quarters has become an admired figure for his flamboyant court crusades against the country’s rich and powerful.

byline.original: By DECLAN WALSH and SALMAN MASOOD

lead_paragraph: It was the judiciary’s first riposte after a property baron, testifying in a corruption case, accused the chief justice of accepting $3.7 million in kickbacks and cash.

headline.main: Pakistan Court Initiates Contempt Charge Against Justice’s Accuser
headline.print_headline: Pakistan: Corruption Accuser Faces Contempt Charges
